reviewText: A common misconception about the core is that it only includes the abdominal muscles; instead, it actually includes muscles from the abs, chest, hips, and back.  With that being said, if you are getting this DVD because you saw "core stretch" in the title and thought that this is only an abdominal stretch, you will be sadly disappointed.  You would also be incorrect in assuming that your entire body will be stretched out in this DVD.  It is just what it says and not much more: it is a stretch routine that stretches out your entire core with a little bit of hamstrings thrown in for fun.I'll get my main complaint out of the way immediately: this DVD focuses a little bit too much on the spiritual side of stretching when it could be using that time to do another stretch or two.  Michelle LeMay (the instructor) begins the workout with a centering segment in which she chants (yes, chants) about being grateful.  Who or what she is thanking, I'm not entirely sure.  She finishes the workout like this, as well.  There are also parts of the workout where she tells you to "send smiles to your third eye" or "breathe deeply into your heart center."  These parts were all a bit too "new-agey" for me and weren't why I bought a stretch DVD instead of a meditation DVD.Apart from that, I really have no negative comments about the DVD; all of the stretches feel wonderful on my body.  After the centering section, you start to do some standing roll downs, first to the front then to both sides.  You then do caterpillar rolls before moving to the floor for a cobra pose.  Michelle believes in massaging muscles with movements, so in nearly all poses or stretches you will be rolling side to side in the stretch.  You do this in the cobra pose, both with your hips and torso.  You then move back into child's pose before going into a bird of paradise segment.  This sequence lasts a while, but you eventually move to a seated forward fold.  After forward fold, you will do a straddle stretch. You finish the seated stretches with pigeon poses.  You then lie down and do a few more hip openers before finishing with the chanting that I mentioned earlier.There is a bonus stretch fromMichelle LeMay's Sprit Flow: 7 Essential Stress Relieversthat is just a few rolls from seated position.Overall, although I didn't like the spiritual aspects that were applied to this stretch workout, I could easily skip them and enjoy a relaxing and truly rejuvenating stretch.  I recommend this DVD to intermediate stretchers who are moderately flexible.  If you're looking for something a bit more beginner friendly, I'd recommend the aforementionedMichelle LeMay's Sprit Flow: 7 Essential Stress RelieversorCrunch - Candlelight Yoga.  If you're instead wanting a total body stretch, then try Michelle'sMichelle Lemay's Spirit Flow: Alive in Your Body.
summary: A wonderfully relaxing core stretch DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: A few months ago I decided to get some stretch videos after enjoying the rare stretch workout shown on FitTV.  I sit at a computer most of the day and needed something to help with my flexibility and muscle stiffness.  Of the four DVDs I bought, this was by far the best.LeMay has a very soothing voice and encouraging demeanor.  Her instructions are easy to follow and most of the stretches are simple, although I do recommend watching the video once before trying it, just so you know what to expect.  The music is a nice background instrumental and the graphics are basically LeMay on a mat that appears to be gently floating on the clouds with words occasionally floating past.The workout starts with a centering stretch for a few minutes.  Then it goes to the full stretch workout, which is followed by a seated (on the floor) stretch and then a final centering.  If you do the entire thing it's about 28 minutes long, but you can also choose chapters and just do centering, full, or seated.  There's a bonus stretch tacked onto the end of the DVD which is only about 3 minutes long.One of my concerns was how this workout would be for someone like me who is considerably overweight.  I discovered I could do almost all of the stretches within the first 3 times of viewing, although one stretch does involve kneeling on your knees, and that's the only stretch I had problems with.A couple of random things: You will need a lot of floor space for some of the floor stretches.  Also, you'll want to do this at least a couple times a week to get the most benefit from it.I can't recommend this DVD highly enough.  I also recommend catching LeMay's episode of "All Star Workouts" on FitTV.  It's a different kind of workout but it's also very good, and we could always use more good stretch workouts.
summary: one of the best stretch videos
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very nice stretch DVD.First, Michelle LeMay's voice is soothing and pleasant. She's remarkably flexible, but she tells you to stretch within your own range.The "set" is LeMay on a carpet that seems to float in the sky, which, once you get used to it, is very soothing.  Words such as "breath" and "relax" float through the "sky" occasionally, but it's pleasant, not weird.No, she doesn't chant, as another reviewer said. If anyone's been to a yoga class or done some yoga DVDs, LeMay's opening centering and closing centering will be familiar.This is a yoga inspired stretch, but there's no Sanksrit and child's pose and pigeon pose are as close as she gets to familiar yoga poses.If you do the DVD, you will find it "rejuvenating," as the title states.The music is wonderful - soothing and relaxing.This is a nice 30-minute stretch for someone seeking flowing stretches with short holds.Although it's been a while since I've done the "Alive In Your Body" by LeMay, a lot of the moves felt familiar.
Title: N/A

reviewText: its very relaxing and yet you stretch and pay attention to your inner self. i started this dvd upset over one of mundane usets of a normal day yet right away all that tension just melted away..I like Michelle as an instructor. shes very enthusiastic yet calming. i'm looking very much forward to repeating this experience.
summary: I just love this stretch/spirit DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: Michelle LeMay's beautiful healing stretching routine brings new meaning to a "movement meditation." Her warm Norah Jones/Rachael Ray type personality radiates on screen as her soft voice leads you through a series of stretches designed to release all your tension as you float away on clouds. Yes, clouds. There are clouds and a magic carpet. As the carpet floats in a calm sky of fluffy clouds, Michelle LeMay returns you to the world of peace.Where other instructors teach you to stretch and then hold the stretch, Michelle LeMay rocks and nourishes the body. You move from side to side in some of the leg stretches and I enjoyed the spinal rolls, bird of paradise and careful pacing. Her cueing is more like guidance and her energy is subtle and healing. If you have been looking for a 30-minute stretch routine, I can recommend this highly.~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A
